intro: Grewia mesomischa, commonly known as the red gum tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small to medium-sized shrub or tree that typically grows in coastal regions and sandy soils. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a distinctive red or reddish-brown color when mature. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that splits open to release seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
